Those things were comfy if you know how to wrap your foot well, but most people were shit at it, and they had bruises the size of tushkanos on their feet. Those pansies got shot first. They were always too careful. Smart doesn’t always work, you know. But back to the wraps: they dried well, they lasted a lifetime, and most importantly, they could be used for other “non-approved” ways. Smart guys used to carry two pairs of them along. Whenever one pair gets wet, they replace it with another, their feet always in a perfect shape, you could eat with those feet if only the toes were longer.

Sometimes it’s not worth it. When you have heaps of loot, and dogs are after your ass, then it’s time to drop some shit. Calculate what is worthwhile, if it’s heavy and you won’t need it too much, then you can casually leave a present for your attackers behind you. If it’s small, light and expensive, then you don’t part with it till you reach the base. I used to throw away things like that while running, and there would be a trail of useless junk behind me.

I save everything, I have never sold anything to any of those greedy bastard traders in the Zone. I keep everything in secret stashes all over the Zone, and they are really hard to find. I hoard things, and these are not some useless things you can find anywhere. One day they may be of some use, and I will stick it up the assess of all those amateur psychologists that diagnose me with ailments they’ve read in old magazines.

Some people only react when threatened. When you really need some loot, try shooting your prey in the legs or hands. When they lose their wits because of the agony, or just get scared shitless, you should have a nice chat with them, ask them where their stash is. Some fools will tell you, and after that you can do with ’em whatever you want. I caught a bandit and cut his trigger finger, after some time I saw him firing with the other hand at some Stalkers. Should’ve cut his head, that rat bastard.

The Zone has no mercy, ever. The Zone is living proof that God either does not exist, or doesn’t give a fuck. Although He could be this mean bastard that wants to torture us, but that is almost beside the point. Don’t expect anything good from anyone here. If I saw you with plenty loot, barely breathing and far from the base, I’d take a shot at you, do not think I won’t. We are good buddies here, but outside it’s a different matter. The Zone has its own rules, and we can only abide by them.

Respect the people of the Zone and the Zone itself. Always have at least a grain of respect, because without it we are just like animals, howling and giving in to their urges. Respect is what brings people to the Zone and allows them to stay alive. It doesn’t care what you did or how you came here, who you are or where you come from, the Zone will cut you down if you forget respect. I keep a reminder of it right here in my pocket, always. It’s one of my toes. One of those gravity anomalies almost sucked me in, and threw a piece of my foot 20 meters away. Had to crawl to bring it back to base for the doctors to stitch it back. But it was a bit too late, and now I carry it here. If you don’t want to keep a reminder like this, you should always remember about respect.

I came here with only one thing in my bag and thanks to it I’m still here and not lying in a ditch somewhere, half eaten by mutants. My switchblade has been with my ever since boot camp. And I do take care of it, every time some gunk gets stuck into the mechanism, every time dirt and sand as much as touch my knife, I make sure to make it sparkly clean afterwards. It’s my baby. I mean, it’s common sense if you want things to last for life. And this cutter was made to accompany you all your life, if you take care of it. I cut meat, cut mutants, cut bandits and I even cut myself when I need some nasty insect larva removed. You can use it to open cans, open old locks, open up screws, open up someone’s belly because they can’t take a hint. Ammo you spend, grenades even more so, the knife stays with you forever, and it’s a mark. It marks exactly what kind of a person you are.

You know why these fools carry around teeth with them? They think teeth of their enemies, especially golden teeth, carry the souls of their owners, so when shit hits the fan, you have someone to watch your back. These idiots don’t realize how stupid they are, ghosts don’t have eyes nor mouths, they can’t even use weapons, for fuck’s sake. How exactly are they going to watch their backs now, huh? Ah, sometimes people make me so mad I can’t control myself and just put a bullet in their heads. After I’m done with them, I take their cherished golden teeth and sell them to whoever wants ’em, and I put some sand in ’em for good measure and so they won’t tell enemies that someone is coming.

I have no friends, only some familiar faces. I know that guy, he sold me some food once, another one smiles like an idiot all the time. I don’t even remember their names, they drop like flies so fast, it’s not really worth it. And new ones come in by the hundreds, they’re really like moths attracted by those fluorescent lights, just to be fried in an instant. That’s a fitting description of the Zone, I think. Friends get you killed around here. What happens when he gets surrounded by snorks, and you have to “save” him because he’s such a good friend? You die, right there and then. Instead of one, now there are two corpses. My only real friend is my gun, and if you have even a slightest interest in staying alive, then you should really cherish only your shooter and nothing else.

My family is shit, or rather is in deep shit. I mean, it’s really bad back home. No food, no money. I send them money in this gray box, but they say only half comes to them. Always someone takes the other half. When I find that fucker, I will rape his face with my knife.

Do not touch junk that is not your own. Whatever it is. What if it’s bottled anthrax? Do not throw it out, unless you wanna die a horrible death. Even if you find a hundred thousand in cash, even if you think you could just break away from the Zone and live like a king for a few months, you will get hunted down like a bloody animal. You were dead the moment you took that cash. So , keep your hands to yourself and to the things you personally own, everything else should be invisible to you. I hate telling this to every freaking newbie out here. No manners, these morons.

I’ve done it all, man, I’ve been here for so long. I’ve seen waves of pseudodogs flood bases, pseudogiants fighting between themselves, I’ve even seen controllers talk with people. Yeah, I’ve seen that. I smoked a ton of ganja before that, sure, but it was so that my head doesn’t explode from the sound of those screeching auras those controllers emit. When you face them, whatever you do, just keep calm, and concentrate on either running away from the sound, or do the iron balls manoeuvre, that is run towards the sound and prepare to unload everything you have into their head. Would not recommend that one though. I’ve seen tough guys weep like little babies when they fail. Soon after they get mind snapped and they can’t even be called people anymore.

Naturally, I’m the perfect man for this place. I’d say that I’ve got exactly what it takes to make it here. I was swinging through a bunch of prisons throughout Eastern Europe before I found this hellhole. Some of them were of better standard than some grade A hotels. Jesus, there was room service in one of them, how the hell was I supposed to repent for my crimes when it was so good to be there? I managed to escape from the last one, I shived a guard, didn’t care whether he had any family, kids, lover, I didn’t give not one fuck about it. So I came here, at least the prison here is much, much larger. It almost feels like freedom, and that’s who I joined immediately when I arrived. Duty has their connections with the law. Me and the law don’t get along actually. Some of the pussies in Freedom tell me I’m a monster, but once the real monsters come, guess who’s gonna save their asses? But my speciality is murder, I can cut up a man faster than a pig, so they use me against Duty whenever the situation calls for it.

In here, you side either with people or with the mutant beasts roaming the place. If you are a beast, you’ll get hunted for sure, if you are civilized enough and act like a person, you might survive for a while. We stick together, and that is why there are human settlements in this hell’s kitchen. If we don’t stick together, the Zone would turn into a wasteland of unseen proportions in no time. Even if it’s a bandit roach, keep him alive, shoot him in the foot and get his stash, but leave him be. There is barely any people here, and you going around wasting good folks is not in anyone’s interest. I know you want to be Rambo and are trigger happy all the time, but you won’t be Rambo for long here. Rambos don’t survive in the Zone for long.

Those fucks think they have it better than us. It is them that are prisoners, prisoners of comfort, prisoners of taking the easier path. They wouldn’t last here. Not one of them would make it one day, it’s going either going to be the food, or the air, or the hellspawns walking like they own the God damn place. If the Zone gets bigger and engulfs the whole world, we will be the most experienced and at the top, not them. They’d be hiding in some greasy corner with bags of gold and useless money. Try nibbling on a piece of gold, it doesn’t do shit. I love their condescending tone, every time some new guy comes in and speaks to us, he acts all high and mighty, it’s like we are living in a gutter, and they’ve come here to enlighten us. There was once a Christian missionary or a Muslim prophet, some prick like that. He came with food and medicine, promising the salvation of our souls. And virgins. Lots of pure virgins when we go to heaven. Not one Stalker bought his bullshit. Natural selection weeds out the idiots, or rather the Zone does, and those that are left? They don’t value bullshit very highly. The guy that wanted to enlighten us was enlightened himself when he stepped into a lightning anomaly. He actually did survive, but he was badly burned and went back home immediately.

I heard about this guy that came to the Zone and refused to fire any weapons. He was a pacifist of some sort. Coward by my book, but that is irrelevant. Yeah, and he decided to stay here, make some money by helping the traders out, packing supplies, cleaning the beds, all those little things. At first, nobody respected him, they considered him a fool. After a while he started to grow on people, and they started to be dependent of him. He’d know who needs what, where and how. He actually sent money to that shitty country in Eastern Europe he came from. Imagine that, making money in the Zone without weapons? He is still a coward, but a crafty one indeed. He still has never left the base, and sends letters with cash back home. I think he has some family there.

Trading works around here for one reason: “shitty crook traders get fucked very quickly.” There was this one lad, had the appearance of a soldier, that one. He started selling trinkets that were supposed to be half-artifacts. People bought it for a while, carried them around as if some new fashion trend started in the Zone. That kid got some money this way, started selling his goods to more experienced Stalkers, but they don’t buy bullshit as you might have learned by now. So they took the so called artifacts to the scientists, they did some research and guess what happened to the kid? He might still be hanging by his intestines from those cranes up in Zaton. They didn’t kill him immediately, no. They just ripped him open like a bag of chips, and hanged him by his guts to be pecked by birds like Prometheus. That is the way they die. I bet a lot of people saw that, and a lot of hopeful crooks took note and downsized their businesses.

I had that fucker as a landlord back in Kiev. He was a shitbag then, he’s a shitbag now. He’s even a worse shitbag now. I got into debt, did a little of those “games,” had to try out my luck. I don’t do that anymore, mostly because everything goes to the “landlord.” He owns me, man, I’ve thought about putting a bullet through his head, but I’m not one of those people. It seems like I could never repay the debt I have, and I just go deeper and deeper. I think he’s making money off me. At least my family back in Kiev has a roof over their heads. That is the least that I can do for them. He does take care of that part. I studied to become a technician, not a fucking hunter. Whenever I stab some poor flesh all I can think about is how disgusting this is, but this is how I keep my family safe back home. Should’ve accepted that job at the bank, what a fool I was back then. I had this superficial view on reality, and thought banks were just plain evil. You know, I thought banks were evil, but gambling isn’t. I deserve rotting here in the Exclusion Zone.

You should be a rock, able to withstand waves of shit and gore that the Zone hits you with. But every rock needs its base. Nobody survives without some help. Either the mutants get you, or, if you’re one of those nimble motherfuckers, some illness or even greed will get to you. Eat Zone-produced food only once in a while. If you overdo it after a day or two, you’ll throw up more than you eat, it’s really not worth it. The cancer should put you off too, but who the hell survives in here long enough to be diagnosed with cancer or actually die from cancer? That shit takes a while to develop and slowly engulfs your major organs. So be resourceful and visit the bases once in a while. Unload, unwind and talk to some people, one of those people might drag your unconscious ass back to base when a controller says “hello.”

They say keep your friends close and your enemies closer. I like to keep everyone as close as possible. I keep an eye open at all times. Try catching me off-guard, even when I’m sleeping. I’m always alert and ready to kick some ass. But traveling alone is fucked up. I only travel with other Zoners. They know their fair share of terror, and they can keep their wits when everything turns upside down and you can barely tell a difference between a person and a mutant. You know, I’d love to keep them mutants close, but they do bite, and they sure bite deep. There was this one guy that kept a pseudodog, not sure how he tamed him, but he is one badass mother fucker right there.

It’s called cumulonimbus cloud formation. ’Round these parts, it means it’s high time to “get the fuck under cover.” Those clouds resemble a nuclear explosion mushroom, but you’d pray it was a nuke if you actually get caught outside. Sometimes the emission just burns you until there is nothing but dust, sometimes electricity fries you like well-done bacon. But the psy storms are the worst. You can hear them speaking to you, and you must listen. The sound is so penetrating you’ll think you’ve grown deaf. Some say psy storms are actually pent up psychic energy of controllers. So if you see this bizarre cumulonimbus cloud formation, stop whatever you’re doing, and start working your way back to base. Emissions are the Zone’s way to tell you: “you need a break.”

I have these growths under my armpit and around my neck, doc says he can’t do anything and when I ask him what it is, he just goes silent. Like a fucking light switch was turned off in his brain. Don’t know what the hell that is, but I live with it. They are slowly getting bigger, I can’t sleep on my back anymore. And the jacket I used to wear? I can barely zip it up. I might just be getting fat, I don’t know, but who the hell gets fat in the Zone? I rub some imported vodka on my back and neck, and the feeling of tightness disappears for a while. Most think I’m a drunk because I reek of vodka all the time, and I go to bed with a vodka bottle. I’ve never drunk alcohol in my life, it’s a religious thing so you probably wouldn’t understand. Fuckit, I’ll just head over to that other doc, he’s always more helpful anyway.

You know that old newbie that hangs around the Yanov station? He’s still a newbie for a good fucking reason. He tried to take some loot from another friend without him noticing. I’d call this theft, but the newbie is a good guy, and I don’t want to see him hanging on a tree. So he took the stuff from his friend, and ran towards some stash he had previously prepared. We knew what he was doing all along, but tracked him anyway because we wanted to find out how he deals with this. Strangely, he returned all the loot and apologised to his friend for his nasty behaviour. He’s been at Yanov ever since, washing dishes, tending to crates, moving ammo boxes. That’s what you get when you fuck with other people’s loot. Well, not really, you get hanged by your intestines on a tree, but that’s what you get when you return the liberated goods back to their original owner on your own volition, realizing the mistake you’ve made. He’s a good guy that one, but we all have our moments of weakness.

I had them in my sights, these mercs that were tormenting some Stalker by the rocks near Zaton plant. I could snipe them off in 4 seconds and it would’ve ended right there and then. I kept my cool though, and it really paid off because another dozen of mercs came afterwards. I didn’t have enough bullets for all of them. I mean, I don’t miss, I don’t waste any bullets. I count every bullet by the price. If I shoot ten bullets, there will be at least ten corpses and I’d have to take “at least” that amount from their loot to break even. This is a good strategy for any visitor or long term Zoner here. When the mercs left, the guy was in so much pain I had to use one of my subsonic rounds with the suppressor not to attract unwanted attention. That was the only time I didn’t calculate how much that bullet was worth. It probably meant everything to that tortured Stalker.

Nobody knows what the hell makes that pecker sound. Some think it’s mutants, the controllers. Other say it’s the weather. Still others claim it is antennas used for secret communication. This is what the rumors say, but what we know is that the Zone amplifies the signal and spreads it over a wider area, affecting any electronic device capable of emitting sound. Some people go insane from it, running into a boar lair or an anomaly. Never fall asleep where the sound is loud, you won’t wake up the same as before. It fucks with your subconscious, you wake up and hear those unintelligible numbers and word combinations that make no sense. I don’t quite understand what that might be, and I don’t really want to find out. I just keep a nice distance from those sounds.

If you see the Z’s, all faceless and slow, don’t just spray them with bullets. That’s like wasting money on slots. You won’t gain anything by doing this. They are tough little bitches, and you won’t be doing any good if you shoot them in the legs or arms. You could easily unload a crate full of ammo in those things, and won’t so much as blink if the bullets miss the sweet spot. Don’t waste money like that, it’s useless. Aim for their spine or go for the head, and they’ll be gone fast. Take your time, breathe steadily and be sure to exploit their weaknesses. Now that you know this, maybe you’ll have better chances and won’t end up filled with bullet holes.

Come, sit with me. Have a drink and relax. The Zone is unforgiving, but that doesn’t mean Stalkers should be like that as well, right? We should enjoy these brief moments of peace because they may be our last. I knew this Stalker, he was always afraid, always kept an eye out for anything. Every little sound made him jump, wouldn’t eat this, wouldn’t drink that. Although he’s survived until now, he’s a wreck, he doesn’t sleep, he doesn’t leave the station, just too fucking scared of everything. If he took my advice and relaxed even a tiny bit, he’d be a different person now, but to each his own.

There was this one time I had to battle two hulking chimeras and these were no normal chimeras. They had three heads, man, that was insane. Even if you took care of two heads, there was still one more left. But it was no problem for my skills, you know? I kicked their asses so hard they bled like stuck pigs. I’ve done a ton of those things, man, no biggie. I once went to Pripyat after hearing all the stories of how fucked up it was. I had to get there, check it out myself. There were thousands of tushkanos, 50 monolith squads at every step, for real. I took down plenty of them but I couldn’t carry anymore loot, so I got back here. By the way, do you have any idea how to release the safety on this piece of shit pistol? I couldn’t figure it out, it’s a new gun for me.

I’m sure you’re eager to explore and wouldn’t to find some shiny artifacts, but what if I tell you that the true treasure of the Zone are definitely not the artifacts? And that’s exactly what I’m telling you, and to get that true treasure you don’t have to fire a single bullet. I know it sounds too good to be true, but that is not a good enough reason to dismiss it. What I need from you is only an initial sum of money, think of it as an investment. And get this, it’s going to spit out a return, ten times what you invested. I found this guy that knows this other guy who set all this up. It’s all legit, you could ask around, but that would just make other Stalkers want to cash in, and this deal might not be on the table for long if that happens. Think about it and bring in the dough when you’re ready.

I don’t really talk to strangers, and we are all strangers here. Most people feel comfortable spilling their life stories to anyone, but I’m not that kind of guy. I realize it’s that feeling of fraternity; anyone who isn’t shooting at you is automatically your brother, and sharing a cup of shroom tea with another Zoner makes him your best friend. See, I never get used to that attitude. I’ve always been left to tend to myself. And that’s alright with me.

Who are you living for? What is the “idea” that keeps you alive when every single thing in the Zone wants you dead? Imagine a democratic poll where everything in the Zone could vote, everything: the emissions, the anomalies, bandits, mutants, cancer, tetanus, radiation, etc. The odds are we would all be dead if things worked that way. The Zone wants you dead, but it even doesn’t need to vote to get what it wants. Quite terrifying, ain’t it? Do you know what keeps me breathing? These kind of conversations. Not vodka, not cocaine, not even those wonderful porn mags Beard sells for a hefty fee, it’s simple chats with simple people like you. Thank you for taking the time to have a nice chat.

They sure put something in the imported tobacco that is being sold here, it reduces the effects of radiation and helps the body recover. Some fantastic shit the Ukrainian government came up with when they had to deal with the first Chernobyl explosion. So smoking one cig after eating some shitty cyst-infested meat from the Zone really works wonders. Unless you want to spend a whole day puking and get cancer in a few years. We are all sterile anyway, our balls can’t handle the radiation, and those that aren’t yet sterile have defective sperm. Imagine watching your beautiful wife give birth to a disgusting mutant, just because you spent a few months in the Zone back in when you were young. Everything has consequences, or at least that’s what the doctors say.

Tag along with larger groups when you’re not prepared for the horror of being alone. They won’t mind unless you keep waving a shooter in their faces. That way you get the safety of numbers, you have more fun and you might learn a thing or two from their conversations. You could also learn by watching them in action. Their tactics, how they handle weapons, how they move. It’s all important and essential if you want to stay alive. If not, you could join the ranks of zombies if that shit fancies you. Just walk to their lair or chill outside while a psy emission is raging. I wouldn’t recommend any of these things though, but it’s your call.

The scientists are good folk, they are timid like rabbits. They wouldn’t blow directly on a flower, let alone kill someone. I salute them, they are so dedicated to their cause in spite of such harsh conditions. It’s hard going on each day knowing that your bunker could be overwhelmed by the scum of the Zone, and you can’t do anything about it. I’d rather have basic knowledge of gun handling, but these are educated people, people with a cause. I’m here because I need to sell artifacts. It helps with my terrible habit of collecting money. I’ve been doing that all my life, spending as little as possible, and I still ended up here. I seem to be saving in all the wrong ways, I guess. You have to think of some sort of system to make a decent living. Buy optimal amounts of food, spend the least amount of ammo, just the amount necessary for the job. By observing these simple rules you’ll have much better chances not to end up like me. But I’m a dreamer, a dreamer that collects money just for the sake of it.

I came to the Zone with only one thing. I know you aren’t supposed to take anything here if you want to bring it back, especially if it’s alive and all, because of all the radiation. But it was the most precious thing I’ve ever had. It was a duckling. The cutest little yellow thing. Quacking like crazy all the time. I wanted to keep it inside so that it wouldn’t attract attention. I had a plan on how to feed it and everything. It slept near my heart, where it was the warmest. I had it for 20 days, and when I came to the Zone, it didn’t even survive a few hours. Normal animals don’t last long here. Just those crows, and I’m not even sure they are normal at all. I’ve seen them scream like robots, and gouge out eyes of pseudogiants. They are vicious thieves too. If you have some trinkets, golden, silver, doesn’t matter, they will take it if you stash them somewhere they can easily reach. Once this drunkard started shooting at the sky for no reason and he hit a crow by accident. How surprised he was when he saw that it was holding this golden watch in its beak. It reminded me of the duckling I had with me. I’ve seen my friends die dogs’ deaths in the mud here, but thinking about that duckling just makes my heart break.

Nobody cares about us down here. It’s as if we don’t even exist. The first few days we were in the spotlight. Stalkers, the Zone. Afterwards, they started ignoring everything that’s going on here. Mutants, artifacts, they all think it’s some kind of a hoax. Sometimes even I wonder if these artifacts are any good. I mean, how could we know? I know the scientists are working their magic back in the bunkers, but how do I know that a specific artifact is good for this and not for another thing? It might just be old wives’ tales, superstitious people making stuff up, so they could feel safer in this wasteland. That’s probably not an option since even a seemingly harmless superstition can get you killed. I don’t know, really, it’s a bit too much for me. I know I believe in a loaded gun and a sharp knife. That’s my God right there, cocked and ready to go. I pray to that God by cleaning it and doing basic maintenance, and it’s very rewarding. Especially when it doesn’t get stuck and does exactly what it’s made for.

I want to score big, just once. I’ve been here for a while now, why can’t I get lucky? I follow the right people, carry the right equipment, but it’s always either a shitty flesh or a boar if I’m extremely lucky. And this is not exactly profitable, to say the least. To down a boar I gotta use 4 bullets, and I make 3 and a half back when I sell the stuff I take from it. Fleshes are even worse, no one really wants to buy them. You’d better avoid them altogether and hunt for some bigger game. I heard that this one guy accidentally run into a pack of snorks. He chucked a grenade at them while running away. He didn’t even look back to see what happened, he just noticed that after the noise from the explosion died down, and the whistling in his ear disappeared, he didn’t hear the snorks no more. Now that’s what I call scoring big. He took their feet and hands back to base, sold them at an excellent price. He went home with that money. Lucky bastard. If I waste a grenade at my boars, I would cut my own hand and sell it to the first trader that believes it’s snork’s to make up for the freaking ’nade.

Carrying a lot of equipment takes its toll on you. Exoskeletons are really cool, I know. But try running away from a pack of dogs with that suit on. It will drain you like a leech. There was some talk about boosters that enable you to run, but you still drain fast. I would go for light armor if I was you. You have more options that way, and the best tactic here is actually not getting shot at all. No armor repairs, no pain, no medicine. It’s safe and secure. Although it’s quite rare to see people manage to do this for a longer while, it is quite rewarding when you’re successful. You always have the choice to either pack armor improvements like Kevlar, or put some hydration upgrades that make life much easier.

Every time I see you around, I think to myself: “Now, that is a guy who knows where he is going.” I just loop around in circles, doing the exact same things each day. Getting bitten by a tushkano is not even exciting anymore. It’s as if life has lost any meaning for me. It’s bereft of any essence, and I feel I’ve done my share of living. It’s easy getting lost here, ending up in an anomaly. Quick and painless. I’ve always wanted a death like that. My father was tortured before those bandits tore his throat out along with major arteries. I learned very quickly what happens to a person with torn arteries. Murdering our own kind is just too much for me. I couldn’t even manage to retaliate, to avenge my own father. I had the names and whereabouts of each and every one of those bastards that did that to him. But what’s the point? We will all perish soon enough, I’d rather be dead on the spot than experience what my father went through.

Once I get my hands on a good sniper, I’m off to better places. I might even visit some zombie nests. With a sniper I could off each and every one of those Z’s without taking a single hit. But they don’t come cheap, you’d have to pay that bastard Owl a hand and a leg for ’em. I need my hand for sniping, and my legs are very important for running around as you might already know. Maybe that Haitian or Hawaiian fella has some good deals. I never trust people that are all smiling and nice to me. There is always a catch behind those smiling mouths. I’m good with a sniper too, I used to train with the army. Not in the army, but with it, along with the army. It was an awkward situation, but I was better at sniping than some army grunts. Should’ve come here with more money, but it’s hard to get anything outside and still harder inside. I do what I have to do, and right now, I have to get me a sniper.

One more and I’m done. This is the last one I’m doing, and I’ve done a whole bunch. I used to bring in simple artifacts and pseudo-artifacts. They weren’t worth much, just enough to keep my belly filled with nasty shit that is barely edible. After I got my advanced detector, more expensive shit began to flow. Beard knew my name, I was popular at Yanov. It isn’t easy, this artifact hunting. You can get burned, electrocuted, crushed, you name it. But it’s gratifying. At least I don’t have to put bullets in people’s heads for a living. Not a nice job that one. But sometimes you just have to defend yourself. I had to do it once because some bandits tried to rob me while they were high as fuck on coke. All jittery and such, I had to put them down as fast as possible. Sold their coke too. I felt like a scumbag and a lowlife, but it had to be done. Now I know what routes the bandits have, and I try to not have face to face meets with them. They don’t seem to mind, or and don’t even notice me at all. And that’s a perfect arrangement for me. But all that is in the past now, because this is my last run, and I’m going back to see my sweeties. I have two huskies, one is a big fucker, and the other has some health issues. Well, now that I have so much dough, it shouldn’t be a problem. And even if it’s not so easy, I can pay them with artifacts. That would wake the veterinarians up, I suppose.

Do you know what perpetuum mobile is? Of course you don’t. I’m going to tell you now, and you better write this shit down. A scientist I used to know was researching this peculiar phenomenon that some lights were still functioning after years without a power source, without maintenance. It’s like they were feeding on some source of energy, but it couldn’t be determined what it was. They theorized that those objects had become stuck in the particular time when the Zone was created. They didn’t even seem to age at all. Naturally, the military would want dibs on this technology, them and every company in the world. But these objects that could work seemingly indefinitely just died when disconnected or taken outside the Zone. They were classified as proto-artifacts, and for a while they were deemed uninteresting to science. How aloof of them. Claiming anything in here uninteresting.

Independent scientist groups have started popping up around the Zone lately. Folks that don’t care for the strict regulations of the military, they even might be corporate scientists. Anyway, what they found was that the proto-artifact story was half right. What they found was that the Zone itself was saturated with magnetic fields of a very complex nature. Some electrical devices started charging themselves up without a plug, just by being in the Zone, and sometimes they overcharged, burning up in the process. Tesla worked on wireless energy transfer, or so they say. He would love to get his hands on any of these artifacts. I bet he would’ve been a good Stalker.

You know that this is hell on earth, right? I mean, you’ve been here more than a minute, I presume? This shit is awful as it is, but it’s even worse because it’s like we are in the fucking stone age. Have you seen a functioning truck transporting goods? Have you seen a robot venturing into anomalies, fishing out artifacts while this pseudo-Stalker pushes buttons from a safe distance? You haven’t, I know you haven’t because I’ve never seen that myself. It just doesn’t exist. Complex circuits fry up immediately here, and only smaller devices could withstand the harsh influence of the Zone. All the PDAs here have some form of magnetic shielding or barriers to resist the damaging magnetic forces. Simple mechanism fare much better here, but they too wear out much faster. Have you noticed how often you have to clean your shooter here? It’s like any complex mechanism is a magnet for dust particles. Everything breaks down faster here, and the more complex it is, the quicker it becomes useless.

Every single device made to suck up the magnetic waves the Zone constantly emits fries up before anyone can do any solid measurements. You can’t tame the Zone, you can’t trick it into feeding you. Large scale engineering projects haven’t been attempted because of that. It’s like this place has its own mind, and it does whatever it wants. And “it” certainly doesn’t want to help us.

Have you tried contacting the outside from here? Not possible, mobile phones will fry in your hand as soon as you dial the number. The Zone wants to protect its secrets, I guess. 3G, GPS, radio waves all get scrambled when directed from inside out or the other way round. Even cables for fuck’s sake, they fry up too. It doesn’t make any sense. Powerful military-grade radios manage to maintain contact for only a few moments before they turn off forever. This place is a quiet desert, and it’s bound to stay like that.

During the noosphere rupture a while ago, when the Zone became the Zone, something quite strange happened to some electrical circuitry. For reasons unknown to science, resistance of some circuits has been reduced to almost 1,5 ??•m which is a range normally only present in the most powerful superconductors, those that are superchilled. This has made those circuits work practically for years without any applied voltage as electrons are moving through them in endless loops without losing any energy. As a result, some circuits became self-sustaining and perfectly preserved over the years, being able to propel whatever equipment was plugged into them at the moment of this massive emission. On the other hand, some circuits were completely blown out, and new circuits sometimes don’t even work at all in here. This poses a problem for scientists, especially since they have to magnetically seal their complex mechanisms, which takes a lot of effort, time and is quite costly. If this wasn’t the case, I bet you’d be seeing a lot more scientists than Stalkers around the Zone.

You don’t wanna pass out or stop moving even for a second. If you do, you’re dead meat. No Stalker, good guy or bad guy, will ever help you out if you can’t take care of yourself. If you get shot, even if you have your bulletproof vest, that bitch hurts like a motherfucker. A few more hits and you’ll be struggling to stay conscious from the pain. Do not let that happen. That’s when things end for you. There was this wannabe Stalker, this newbie that just came out of the box, still full of beans, he thought if he invested in a good vest, some bullet-proof plates, he’d be unstoppable. He died somewhere after he ate a few bullets to his chest. The impact crushed his ribs and the ribs punctured his lungs. The pain was too much for him. He threw up his insides, and probably dehydrated right there. They found his body ripped apart by hungry doggies or something uglier. I don’t want to tell the story of how they found your body, aight?

The human body is a very reliable machine. It can function almost flawlessly for decades, and it’s one of the most complex systems in the known world. The Zone is a little bit different. Immune systems don’t work as well as they normally do, coughs last longer, cancer is obviously rampant. It’s as if you are immediately drained once you step inside the Zone. If you wanna stay here, you need a very strong spirit, either in alcoholic form or psychological one, preferably both. Some cowards won’t stand one bite of those dogs, others can go through a lot of punishment. What is different is spirit, and sometimes drugs, but mostly spirit. You need to have strong and pre-defined goals to keep you going through the everyday shit. That is the difference between newbies, adepts and real Stalkers. Anyone can waltz in here, strutting with brand-new weapons and shiny armor, but when it gets awful, some folks break much easier than others, and it doesn’t have anything to do with the weapons you have or the armor you wear. They do help, but what drives you inside is what determines if you live or die.

I used to refuse to carry a weapon. Anything that could hurt another living being was impure to me. But surviving doesn’t come easy. I had to learn the hard way how important it is to have the necessary tools, especially in the Zone. When I first arrived here, people told me I wouldn’t live to see another day. I still refused to buy a gun and I had my reasons. I spent 5 years in an Orthodox monastery, high in the mountains and near this little village. The people there have barely heard about World War II, let alone the Zone. Very peaceful people, calm, resilient. But they don’t have to face the horrors that dwell here. I bet they would throw away their holy books along with their crosses the moment they see a controller staring them in the eye and meddling in their brain. Drilling deep. So I had to change my attitude. I wanted to live and sacrificing my faith seemed like a low price to pay. And that’s how I grabbed my first weapon.

You have to believe in something, man, and in here you quickly learn to believe in hosts of different gods if you don’t wanna go nuts. You know what I’d like to see? A declared atheist run through a fire anomaly. He will start praying to make up for all the years he went on cynically laughing at “petty” religions. Sometimes the only thing you have is that kind of hope, and to take that away under the pretense of “reason” and “science” is just plain stupid. And you’ve already seen what atrocities the atheists have done throughout history. Millions of people dead. Where was their humanism then?

I think this “one God” bullshit is just that: a pile of shit. I mean, it’s just lazy to think that whoever created us would be just one person. I realize it’s kinda complicated to be praying to many gods, so it was natural some people simplified the deal by introducing one true God. But at least they are not cowards not to believe in anything. It takes courage to be hoping for something as beautiful and transcendent as the Gods or even one God. Sometimes you have to keep your mind busy with things like that. If the only thing filling your mind was the horror of the Zone, you would never be able to have a good night’s sleep or relax with a cup of coffee and enjoy good conversation. God is the only thing that separates you from the thick layer of shit of daily life here.

What kind of monster would God have to be to create so much suffering, such widespread poverty, destruction and cruelty? How is that a part of God’s plan? How am I supposed to love, respect or worship something or someone as vicious as God? And religion? It’s just a twisted combination of crazy and contradictory statements. Every single religion. Even the Buddhists have their fundamentalist fanatic killers. Nothing that claims to be fundamentally good could create so much bile and hatred. Whatever the initial intentions of Jesus and Mohammed and all the world’s religious leaders were, however positive and constructive they were, have now become the absolute opposites of what they claimed to be. I’d say that is a massive failure right there. Just pray to yourself, you are your only god and it’s only up to you to survive in this hellhole.

It’s hard to hold on to anything here. Memories of family, friends, some nice moments in the past are quickly erased and replaced by the dripping despair, oozing out of every pore of every man. I had convictions and a strict moral code before coming here. Now I see it’s all shit, it’s all fabrications by people who have a lot of free time on their hands. You think a two-headed chimera would hesitate even for a second before devouring your best friend in front of you? That is what you call a perfect creature: fast, deadly, efficient predator that fears no one and nothing. We have a lot to learn from the beasts, and they have absolutely nothing to learn from us. They are already the masters of the Zone.

Some places, man. It’s just not worth it unless you are some freaking motherfucker with a nuclear blaster rifle or godlike skills. There are areas that only the toughest of Stalkers with the best equipment dare to visit. This is not a zoo, those snorks over there are most definitely not to be fed unless you fancy a quick death, but even then, it’s better to just off yourself right here, and let me take care of your things… er… I meant, I can arrange a proper burial for you. It’s just that many shitskulls that simply came out of their momma’s pussy want to be the hardest motherfucker out there, and jump right into the biggest clusterfucks in the Zone, without any equipment, without any experience, without nothing at all. You can do that in some “normal” places of the world, but the Zone? The Zone definitely is not “normal” by any standards. They probably heard some shit from friends, and want to play a hero. I have to tell you, those folks don’t get to enjoy the Zone too long.

Don’t go strolling where you don’t belong, boy. If you haven’t personally scanned and tested the ground, if you don’t know every single crook and cranny, if you aren’t acquainted with “that particular area,” just stay off. Before going to the Iron Forest I spent 2 months just watching, just observing. Two whole bloody months. That’s almost half your age. And that is why I’m alive and kicking today. I was patient. I mean, sure, that poltergeist fried my back so nice that I still get these reactions on my skin whenever FM signals are amplified. And sure, I had a controller take a look into my brain, but I survived. You know why? I’ve just told you, you worthless punk, I’ve just told you I spent 2 fucking months observing, thinking, wondering. Making a solid strategy before even thinking of doing anything. How are you going to survive in here if you have the attention span of an ADD Japanese hornet?

If knives were our only weapon, we would be so dead right now. The mutants would roam the Zone, and it would’ve been rather quiet. These are no mammoths or elephants, man. The mutants are something else, something much more vicious than anything we’ve ever encountered outside. We are most definitely not made nor supposed to survive frontal attacks of those beasts. That’s why we compensate for our lack of superhuman shit with the right tools. We just have to shoot ’em hard and shoot ’em where it hurts. A lot to remember, I know, but this is crucial if you want to save your ass from becoming a snack, or if you simply want to get some dough by selling mutant meat or organs. I mean, it’s a lucrative business, but not a safe one. Look at artifact hunting. If you fuck it up, your life ends almost immediately, so you don’t really suffer. Much, at least. But if you fuck it up with those beasts, you are looking at bleeding out in 2 or 3 minutes, best case scenario, and worst case, you’ll eaten bit by bit, from bottom to top, in hours, sometimes days. Some Stalkers got real good moves that they’ve learned over the course of many years in the Zone, things that newbies just can’t get at first try. It’s muscle memory. If you survive a boar attack once, you will catch a glimpse of how you should move to avoid it. It doesn’t seem like much, but some experienced Zoners could hold off 4 or 5 of those boars at the same time, no problemo. Still, I wouldn’t like to be in their shoes. I’d rather be like Beard or Hawaiian.

No easy money here. Fools come here, think they’d get fat rich with a few artifacts and after a few hunting sessions. That’s bullshit, my friend. You’ll be lucky to survive. Not to say there is no way to make money, but you have to use everything mother nature provided you with: your intelligence, reflexes, spirit, everything you’ve got, synced to perfection, to be able to get a tiny piece of the cake. Not many of us return to the Great Land, they either die, or get stuck in this hellish cycle: get drunk, cure your hangover with mushroom tea, look for some artifacts or hunt some mutants to get the cycle going, and so the cycle begins anew. And you can’t just decide to leave, going back costs money too. Everything’s got a price on it, and either you buy it with cold cash, monster hides, weapons, favors or using your own fucking skin. As you can see, nothing is easy here, and this place is certainly not for everybody. It sure has its own way of showing this.

Making money costs money. You just calculate how much your “investment” costs, and determine the risk and the return. What the hell did you think? This shit is all business and math. Nothing else to it. These sorry ass bitches walking around, looking like tough bastards, brandishing heavy weaponry, they are all mathematicians and businessmen. Some with PHDs and university diplomas. It’s a hard place to live, and it’s even a harder place to run a business. See, what I do is I calculate the price of the bullet, the price of repair and how much I have to spend if I wanna survive that specific “adventure.” And if the return is big enough, I know what I’m doing next. Calculations like that you’ve got to make all the time. Do I shoot the boar that is chasing me, or keep my ammo for that raid on that bandit camp? Making money sure does cost money, sometimes more than you actually make. You make bad mistakes, you end up in the swamps. And that’s all the philosophy there is to it.

You want to make the big bucks, yes? Make the big bucks from artifacts, yes? Stupid boy, you need to cover yourself proper first. Put on a SEVA, eat pills that make you hold against that anom type, and those bolts aren’t for hunting mutties. You could make a very simple, basic combination of anom protection, but then you have to be super-fast at going for that artifact, and some anom’s are even too hard for any basic DIY combination you could make. They require professional equipment. Remember, the higher the risk, the more money you get… Sometimes. Other times you get nothing and you just spend all that you have. So don’t be stupid, “Stalker,” be smart, and alive, or just leave this place, we have enough corpses on the ground, and some even walking. Oh, I’m not from around here so sorry for my language.

Bandits are the scourge of this land. Awful, tricky weasels that will kill you and rob you, and sometimes they’ll do even worse things to you. Some of them are ex-Stalkers, sure, but really, it’s what they’re doing now that matters. They have no morals, no codes, no underlying structure or rules. If you are just starting out here, and you see a squad of those bastards, you’d better keep off and away. Like some fiends, they can smell a chance to grab some nice loot. Sometimes they won’t shoot. Sometimes they will rape you before you can say that you surrender. If you want to take on the sheriff’s badge and get rid of that scum, you’d need to be equipped for the job. You can just start blasting, and expect to survive. You ambush them, study their movement patterns, their formations, their habits. If their squads were easy to take down, we wouldn’t have people walking in groups. Sometimes a controller is easier to kill than a well-trained squad. Shoot the head, shoot to kill, and then move to the next target. Keep something between you and their bullets, some armor, get boar hides if you have to, and wipe them off. But you don’t look like the fighting type, you’ve been listening to me rant for 10 minutes about this shit, when it’s such an excellent opportunity to walk around outside and get some fresh air. Do it. Now. Get out of here. OUT!

Veteran Stalkers, regular Stalker, hell, almost every Zoner has adapted so well to the Zone over the years that killing them sometimes seems outright impossible. Not that I want to shoot any of them, but hear me out. I think that the Zone not only makes them harder on the outside, but also it has specifically worked its magic on the inside. A civilian that came here would whine and go into a shock after being shot in the leg. A Zoner will fix that shit up, he won’t lose touch with the reality of situation and maybe even plan an escape route. Sometimes a veteran Stalker will get shot, but the bullet will be a lucky one for him, and it will miss all major arteries and vital organs, and it would seem like he’s bulletproof. Not sure if veteran Stalkers have found the Oasis or some any form of healing artifacts or whatnot, but that will seem really strange to you only if you weren’t here for long. I’ve seen a guy get shot in the head and pull through. There was one guy in Russia, I’ve forgotten his name, this giant pole was stuck into his brain, another had his head severed almost completely, and they both survived. Outside? It’s a massive stroke of luck and a miracle. Here? Here, the rules bend and are bent. Bullets stray away, are deflected of invisible walls that later turn out to be an anomaly or a poltergeist pulling the strings of gravity. But if you fill the head with enough bullets, nobody can survive that. Even the Oasis wouldn’t help those poor bastards. You’ll find the place one day, too, I’m sure, but in the meantime, put on a metal baseball cap or something.

A firefight is a hellish thing. Bullets zipping by all around you. Some bury deep into your flesh, some just zoom past you and hit something or someone else. It’s chaos, pure and simple. Sometimes you can survive a bandit ambush from all sides, and sometimes one guy can get lucky and strike you down with one well-placed shot. And even if he doesn’t kill you, he most certainly will damage your gear. Stuff is barely functioning as it is, and it sure ain’t bulletproof, so it’s going to get raped in a firefight. That’s reality and that’s how it works. Nothing you can do about it.

When you shoot a guy, you won’t find everything he had on him, there’s no way in hell that’s gonna happen. The stress of the fight, the shock of killing someone, it all affects your senses. Sometimes you will find a pack of cigs he was smoking earlier, sometimes you won’t find them. Maybe he wanted to hide the pack since it was his last, who knows. You won’t get everything you think you deserve, the Zone is not about fairness after all, so cut it out with all that nonsense right know and grow some testicles. And yeah, if the guy you just shot drops like rock onto something or rolls down a cliff, his stuff will get mushed, broken, destroyed. So you won’t have a chance at dipping in that butter jar at all.

No one has as much free time as you do, and Cardan is no exception. Don’t assume he’s just waiting for you to get your ass to his workshop and shove your sticky, shitty, wasted shooter on his desk. No, no, hell no. He’s got his own shit to worry about apart from fixing all the weapons of the world. Sometimes it’s just more worthwhile to fix the shit yourself. Clean the gun once in a while, lubricate it. Get a repair kit and use it when you really need it. But don’t forget the eroding and destructive power of the Zone that will devour your soul as much as it will devour machinery. Cars don’t last here, nor do helicopters or sophisticated machines. Keep it simple, keep it clean, keep it going, and you might see another day.

I never sell any repair items, man, I just keep them in my box. I know it’s good loot, Beard, Owl and Hawaiian love to buy ’em, but I think it’s better to just use ’em for my weapons and armor. When you sell something to someone, you sell it cheaper than the price you can buy it for, and then when you buy repair items from someone else, you’ve got to pay again, and in the end you lose a lot of money. Do shit on your own, it’s much more frugal and you get to save a lot. Stalkers don’t know how to save here, and whine all the time that they don’t have enough dough. What did you think when you came here, you motherfucking piece of dead rat? The Zone taxes you. Materials are hard to come by, weapons even harder. You don’t just pay for that one shooter, but you pay for the whole infrastructure that supports the war machine that enables you to buy that one shooter. It’s a simple economy, and you should be aware that everything here is expensive as doing everything has its risks and its costs.

Have you noticed that the Zone just freezes sometimes? It stutters, and everything else stops for microseconds. We call this the Stutter. Some say it’s an echo from the first Chernobyl explosion, coming back to remind us of the horror. Some say it is neurological, and our brains, under the influence of the Zone, have problems processing sensual information. And the latter has been proposed by those scientists in the bunker. They’ve studied the phenomenon and are still baffled by some aspects of it. I have a theory that the stutters are actually microemissions, happening so fast that they can’t hurt anyone, but are annoying as hell, especially in the middle of a fight. If some genius Stalker comes up with a way to negate that effect for himself, he’ll have a massive advantage over the rest of us. Alas, such Stalker has not yet appeared, and the Stutter always keeps us company. I really hope the Stutter doesn’t cause any neurological damage, I don’t want to leave this place retarded or something.

Flashlight is a basic tool here. You can’t shoot what you can’t see, you can’t walk where you can’t see. Every Stalker usually carries a flashlight. It’s a great tiny thing, mind you, no external batteries are required for it to work. But for more experienced or well-off Stalkers there are also headlamps that Owl has sometimes in stock. And they’re great too, because they free up both of your hands. That comes in handy when you wanna shoot with a two-handed weapon or have to use both of your hands for some other “activity.” But remember that headlamp needs to be equipped and uses battery power from the UPD. Night vision is another expensive story but I can’t tell you shit about it. Just remember that the headlamp is automatically shut off when you are using the handheld flashlight.

We know everyone, and everyone knows everyone here. We are like a small village. A newcomer comes up, he shines like a dying star. Everybody can notice newcomers right away, and we don’t particularly trust them. I won’t go into details as to why, mostly because you are a newcomer too, but it has something to do with earning respect and doing something useful for this little community we have here. Growing the mushrooms, hunting some monsters and chasing some bandits, these types of things. And if you do good, we might even help you when you’re in a pinch. Some morons come waiving the latest and greatest of the outside world, and then get robbed before they can say “hello” or “how do you do.” They think equipment is what makes the difference here, and they couldn’t be more wrong, ’cause it’s not. It’s experience and respect of the people.

I’ve opened up a boar, yes. What’s it to you? I wanted to find out why they weren’t dying that easily when I unloaded everything I had into their heads. When I opened that fucker up, I noticed their brain and major organs moved to the back of their head. In short, they mutated and adapted superfast to us shooting their mugs. Their tissue is as hard as Kevlar, for fuck’s sake. Not sure how this was possible since I didn’t have a microscope, and even if I had one, I wouldn’t know how to use it, but I have to tell you that my knife did not go through that shit at all. And I sharpen it every single day. I did notice though that their thighs, our favorite meal, are more soft, and if you shoot them enough they open up like a can of tuna. But strange beasts they are, maybe they’ll get used to it and grow some extra-hard muscles there, and become masters of the Zone, banishing all Stalkers… Probably not.

Who wants a shooter in their mouth? Not Stalkers, not bandits, not even your best friends. It is disrespectful and just plain annoying. I’d smack anyone who comes up to me with his shooter towards me, even if I’m selling him something. The trigger finger is a gentle thing, not to be trifled with. Sometimes the gun can shoot for seemingly no fucking reason, and what do you think would happen if it was my face in front of that shooter? You so eager to find out? I’m not, and I’ll beat the ass of anyone who points the gun at me. Treat people with respect, and you won’t get hurt. Well, bandits ain’t people, so in their case it’s a roll of the dice. Maybe they’ll shoot you, maybe they won’t, but you shouldn’t feel too safe near ’em.

The better your shooter, the more modern and clean it is, the more you can upgrade it. Although worn or old weapons are usually initially cheaper, it’s worth to invest in a better profile, instead of being greedy and buying a cheaper older version. Upgrades can really change your life and they increase your life expectancy too. If it wasn’t for the full auto mode on my shotgun, I wouldn’t be telling you this. I’d probably be some Zombie, drooling all over myself, and shooting anything that has brains I can eat. Damn, I’m very happy that I managed to get out of that shit bucket. This place is not much of an improvement, but I like the company much better.

I’ve been here since the beginning, man. Ever since the Zone was wild and everyone was killing everyone to hold down a rusty piece of shit in the middle of nowhere. It was dog eat dog, kill or be killed… Some say it has never changed and it has always been like this. I just don’t agree. There was a time when it was different, you know? More order. It’s like God, right? You might be indifferent to him, and he may be a fucking cruel and spiteful being who only wishes to rape and destroy everything you hold dear, but there was some sort of logic to the madness… The Ten Commandments and shit… keep to this, and you’ll probably be alright. The Zone used to be like this. You could sort of predict what was going to happen…. now it’s all changed. Everything’s gone to shit… you can’t predict anything. Artifacts used to be visible to the naked eye, the Monolith kept to themselves… now that some crazy fucker turned the Scorcher off and everyone went north, all bets are off. There’s no God left in this place, man. Only the Zone… and if that doesn’t terrify you, you clearly haven’t been here long enough.

I knew this guy once; name of Scar… Craziest motherfucker I’ve ever seen. He had a deathwish. No matter how dangerous the mission was, no matter how unlikely it was he was going to come back alive, he took it… didn’t have a care in the world. Can’t imagine why someone would be like that… he must have been pretty screwed up in the head, right? But here’s the crazy thing… It seems like nothing could finish that bastard off. He once got hit by two emissions in the space of a week, was out in the open, and survived both times. Can you fucking believe that? It’s like the Zone saw his challenge and wanted to punish him for his arrogance. Ain’t nothing for free in this world, man. Not even Death, if the Zone doesn’t want you to have it. Some reckon he sold his soul to the Zone… God only knows what happened to him. He fell off the face of the world.. but someone like that doesn’t go easy, you know? Wonder what he’s up to now…

I know the Zone’s a harsh place… but some people go way overboard. I was travelling with a Stalker the other day, and we heard some moans. Turns out a group of Loners got fucked by a bloodsucker. They managed to take it out, but they were hurting pretty bad, man…. And this guy, he pulls out his shooter, walks over to each of them and puts a bullet in their heads. Killing them in cold blood… How can people be like that? He said it was the merciful thing to do… But couldn’t we have done something else? It wasn’t that far from the camp… we could have dragged them there and tried to help, you know? Even if we wouldn’t have been able to save all of them, one or two would make it. The Zone makes monsters out of people, Stalker… That’s for fucking sure.

One thing I really can’t stand is people who are cruel to animals. Yeah, there’s my type in the Zone too. Don’t get me wrong, I understand the laws of the Zone: it’s kill or be killed, and if an animal is dead set on your life then you have to do what you have to do to survive… But I always avoid encounters with them whenever I can, and if I have to kill them, I try to be as humane as possible. Too much unnecessary suffering in the world, man, so let’s not add more to it. See this shotgun? It’s designed so that it takes down almost anything in one shot. Yup, just like Trapper’s. My types usually join the hunters… for some reason. Guess they figure that culling certain animals is a necessary evil and it’s better to do it efficiently and humanely without making them suffer, you know? I came across a group of bandits the other day. They had a dog and were cutting parts off it while it was still alive. Maybe it was a “monster,” but still: it’s a living being… If there hadn’t been so many of them, or if I had a better gun, I wouldn’t have hesitated to kill those bandit monsters myself. The Zone redefines the rules, that’s a given, but you need to cling to what’s left of morality inside of us… or else you become a monster yourself.

The Zone changes people, mate. It’s true… Everything you see, everything you do, has to benefit you in some way or you’re not going to make it. You’re forced to become this perfect economic actor: you gotta chose a course of action that will turn out to be the most profitable or else you’ll end up dead. Maximum profit with least effort, that’s the way your brain is gonna work after your cells get used to constant threat of death. And if you’ll gain the most by slaughtering some guys that wouldn’t harm a fly, so be it. They would be dead in no time anyway, but what if one of them has something of value to you? Survival of the fittest, man. Weaklings don’t make it, the strong survive, so you better be sure you’re one of the latter, an alpha, before you go starting any feuds, because if you’re not you’re in for a world of hurt.

I never used to buy into that religious crap, you know? God is great, god is merciful, god is a vengeful and jealous fucker. How can he be all three? And at the same time? No one could answer this question for me, and so I didn’t believe. Then I came into the Zone and my perspective changed completely… They say there’s no atheists in foxholes, but you’d have to be a pretty hardline motherfucker to be one here too. You gotta see it with your own eyes, experience it first-hand, and you’ll be reborn. There’s things here that defy explanation. I guess you can look at it scientifically: evolution of mutants, chemical reactions in anomalies, and so on… But there’s stuff here that science just can’t explain. And exactly such a thing happened to me. A friend of mine died when we were kids. It was a stupid mistake… never should have happened. I guess I always blamed myself for his death, you know? We were into some pretty crazy shit… and it turns out that he was the one who suffered for it. I eventually got over it, as best I could, but you never truly get over something like that. The other day, I saw him. I swear to God, he was right there in front of me. He asked me why it happened. Why I didn’t do anything. I damn near broke down and cried. He knew everything. What happened, how it was my fault, and how one day I will be judged. Then he was gone… craziest thing I’ve ever witnessed. So yeah, some might like to think the Zone is scientific wonderland, but I think otherwise… This is a cursed place, Stalker. Every day I walk through here, I can’t help but think we’re one day closer to the judgment day.

Hey, watch your back around here. Some guys aren’t like me. They’re proper scum. Me? I live and let live. Provided you stay out of my way, I’ll stay out of yours. Fuck with me, though, and you’re going to regret it when you realize you ain’t got any means of keeping your guts inside you. Yeah. Ask anyone. They’ll tell you not to fuck with me.

I used to be a guide back in the old days. It’s a hard job. Not only are you responsible for your own life, but the lives of others aswell. I speak English pretty well, so I would often take “tourists” into the Zone. Rich fuckers who wanted to see what the Zone was all about, without the hardship of actually living here. Got pretty famous for a while… People started a rumour that I knew the way to the Wish Granter. I didn’t, but I didn’t mind people thinking I did. A lot of business came my way. The thing is… in the Zone you really get to know people. You want to know a man’s character? A week in the Zone will tell you everything you need to know about him.. and the people that came to me, wanting their desires granted… well, it would make me shudder. Empty men, with dead eyes… Nothing they do is ever for the benefit of anybody but themselves. Even if I did know the way to the Wish Granter, I don’t think I’d take a damn soul. Not all wishes are good, you know?

Why are you coming to me? I hope you’re not seeking salvation. I have no right to promise you that all is going to end well, because it won’t. I’m a priest… in word only now, it seems. I used to believe that God was merciful, that He was fair and just… but having seen the things I’ve seen how can I go on preaching? I came to the Zone in the hope of rekindling the faith in these lost souls, but it seems I’ve become lost myself. Nothing could prepare me for this place. I’ve worked in missions all around the world, and even in the darkest moments there’s still some glimmer of faith; of hope. Here? Well, you could walk a thousand years in the Zone and not find a single person who’s a true believer. The Zone beats it out of you, and laughs gleefully while it does.

Saw the freakiest fucking thing ever not too long ago. Me and the boys were on a raid, right… and we found this weird guy. He seemed pretty out of it. Didn’t know what the fuck he was doing or saying. Like some sort of retard, I guess. Had no supplies, no gun, no ammo, no nothing, only his black trenchcoat. We were a bit too soft, felt sorry for him, and we decided to let him come with us. An extra guy might come in handy if shit goes down, right? Even if he’s a wacko. At least that’s what we thought. Went to sleep that night, and it was a gunshot that woke us up. My friend right beside me was screaming like a madman and aiming at something that was hovering over him. Looked like a person, but it was all out of whack… its arms were deformed or something. Guess it tried to kill my friend but he woke up just in time and managed to get a gunshot off, hit this thing in the shoulder and it ran off screaming. That dude we picked up? No sign of him, just his trenchcoat…. Yeah, some weird shit out there, let me tell you.

I usually don’t sleep in camps… Most of the time the “benefits” aren’t worth it, you know? Sure, all this crowd may keep you safe from a mutant attack, but if some fucker steals your piece then you’re fucked either way, right? A lot of thieving bastards out there. And I don’t fancy having so many people around. Crowd mentality, you know? You can never be sure what’s gonna happen next when there’s a bunch of dim-witted morons posing as leaders and telling other idiots what to do. Some might say “safety in numbers,” but fuck that, you know? I stick to the rule that it’s your duty to keep yourself safe and not to rely on others to cover your ass. So I like to pick a nice sheltered spot out in the middle of nowhere… Sure, the occasional mutant might wake you up and you gotta stay on your toes at all times. Yeah, there’s that. But mind that: in the end, it’s you versus the Zone, and not you and your friends versus the Zone. ’Cause your only friend is yourself.

Free will, huh? I have read all sorts of wise books before I came here, but none of this shit applies in the Zone. Free will simply does not exist in this place. There isn’t a single person in the Zone who is here out of choice. Virtually everyone I’ve talked to has the same background. Usually criminals hiding from the law, dodging the draft or just your average Joes that have to provide for their families. And the economic crisis in the Great Land has only made matters worse for everyone. The governments weren’t able to stop it and ended up reintroducing slavery. So the only choice you’ve got is this: escape here or have your life ruined. And that’s hardly a choice at all, you’re only choosing between two brands of misfortune. And all the people, once they get here, realize that their life is pretty much over anyway; they have almost no chance of escaping and average life expectancy is so low that some of them don’t even struggle at all. Some of them, more crafty ones, realize that at least they will be able to send their families some money so that they don’t end up as commodities in the human trafficking market. The entire situation makes me sick…. Sorry, I don’t feel like talking anymore.

Hope is a dangerous thing to have in the Zone. There are those who will tell you it is all that keeps them moving, gives them the drive to go on, but I say it is the most dangerous thing of all. The Zone knows. Everything. Your desires, your wants, you dirty secrets… It knows everything. There’s not a single thought in your head that the Zone doesn’t know, and you can’t hide anything from it. Forget privacy: you should assume that whatever you do, whatever you know, whatever you feel the Zone already knows. And you have to remember that the Zone despises feelings, all feelings, but hope, in any form, makes it especially angry. A friend of mine had a family back home. A beautiful wife and two daughters. He would tell me about them all the time, just couldn’t stop yapping. I remember there was one thing he always carried with him: an album full of photos of his family. He kept telling me that “today was the day” he was going to make it. And it seemed that this day finally came. He got lucky, found an artifact nobody had ever seen before, took it to the scientists and it turned out they were willing to pay a shitload of money for it. Literally. They didn’t have this much dough with them at the moment, so he had to wait for their next supply drop… So yeah, he made it. Then he suffered a bite to the leg. A dog. What started off as a routine infection suddenly got worse. The wound started to fester, maggots made it their home, flies were buzzing around. In no time all flesh in the leg was eaten away. No doctor could help him. Amputation didn’t work, infection spread too fast for us to be able to contain it. And the smell, this god-awful smell, would stay with him till his last day. He died before he could get paid… I don’t know what happened to the artifact. I wouldn’t be surprised if the Zone reclaimed it. After that I wanted to contact his family… Let them know what really happened, but nobody had the slightest idea who he was or where he came from. No hope, Stalker… It will kill you. Trust me on this.

It amazes me how there’s so much talent in the Zone. Every place has its own bards and artists, and the Zone is no exception. But there are differences: in the Great Land poets, writers, musicians tend to be devalued. There’s simply no need for them in a society where expert knowledge is the currency. And here a good story, good music, good read are respected, especially if they will increase your odds in the roulette against the Zone. You could even say that good storytelling shows how experienced you are: the better and more believable your tale, the more shit you must have gone through. But truly exceptional are those artists who managed to hit the softest spots in our hearts. I’ve seen veteran Stalkers moved to tears by a piece of music that reminds them of home; of a happier time. The Zone can be a harsh place, but despite that the human spirit still burns strongly. You can put us in chains, but still we’ll sing and live on, no matter what the Zone throws at us.

Fuck it, almost every guy I talk to shits his pants every time mercs are mentioned in a goddamn conversation. Boogeymen of the Zone, you could say. But not me, I’m not scared of ’em. See, they might have shit-hot equipment and training… but one thing they ain’t got is Zone-smarts. This shit you only learn the hard way; through experience, through sweat and tears. Ain’t no way standard military training allows you to predict when an emission is going to hit… But once you get into the Zone, survive a few of ’em, and you’ll just know. A tingling behind your eyes, your teeth aching, some little sign that tells you all hell is about to break loose and you need to get your ass someplace safe. The mercs think they can take the Zone by force… Impossible, I tell ya. Want to see where that attitude will take you? Look at those military choppers: fucking ripped out of the sky like they were made of paper. The Zone is a cruel, hard bitch, and won’t come down so easily. Especially since it is the absolute ruler and force is a currency it trades in. No use opposing it.
Anyone posting jobs around here?
I’m looking for work.
Know where I can find work?
Sorry, I don’t know.
Spore is always looking for someone to do odd jobs every now and again. He is an information broker. Got the scoop on something big going down in the Zone? Spore will pay well.

I heard Librarian has been seeking experienced hunters to clear out some mutants at different locations throughout the marshes. Seems to be less volunteers to go out hunting at night, so you’ll have a better chance to get the job then.
Sidorovich always has something that needs done. He usually pays well, but I wouldn’t recommend any rookie take the jobs he offers.
Wolf has been looking for help. He pays stalkers to hunt mutants in the local area to ensure the safety of the village.
Owl, who hangs out at the Skadovsk, is always looking to buy or sell information. I would go ask him.
Sultan’s seeking people with balls of steel for some shit. He hangs out back at base, in the throne room.
Head toward the scientists’ bunker. I’m sure they have something. They are always looking for mercs or stalkers to help them out.
Olivius is the man to see if you are looking to do some odd jobs. He is a trader who stays at the Dark Valley camp.
Yeah, here’s a job. From here, head west. Then keep going west. And when you’ve done that, don’t come back.
Sorry, man, I’ve got nothing for you. Just dig in and help us hold on to what we’ve got.
Know anything useful?
How do you manage to stay alive here?
What kind of advice can you give about the Zone?
I really don’t have any advice to give you.
You shoot a guy in the face a couple times, and he’s finished. It won’t matter what he’s wearing as long as it ain’t an exo.
Use a grenade or two to get a guy to shift his ass. He won’t be hiding there much longer if he sees a pineapple roll up next to him.
If you have a fast enough trigger finger, you can fire off both barrels of a shotgun at the same time. Keep that in mind if you run into a bloodsucker.
Don’t underestimate pistols, stalker. They’re pretty handy if you ain’t got much ammo left for your main shooter, and they’ll waste anything with light armour.
If you’re running a hit, you can waste the poor bastard without being seen using a sniper rifle; you’ll be able to whack him from much further than with your other shooters.
You ain’t gonna be able to hit shit if you’re running while shooting. Find some cover to hide behind and lean out to shoot; you’ll be far more accurate.
Keep your gear in good condition. You gun will jam and your suit will be full of holes if you don’t see a technician every now and then.
Last time I went to see a technician, he couldn’t upgrade half my shit… Asked me to go out and fetch tools for him. What, am I his errand boy now?
Ever met a guy who stood outside during an emission? Of course you haven’t! Hide your ass whenever one hits unless you feel like having your brain boiled.
Almost lost my legs the other day. Planted a whole cluster of butterfly mines to cover my ass when scavenging and forgot about them on my way back. They’ll go off no matter who planted ’em.
Just because the trader don’t have a job for you doesn’t mean none of us do. You can make some good money running errands for others. Might find some good loot in the meantime, too.
Keep hold of any meds you might find; you never know when they might be useful. Hercules is pretty good when you’re hauling goods, and psi-block will help you against any controllers.
Carry some spare ammo on you even if you don’t think you need it. Nothing worse than having to fight off a horde of mutants with just your blade.
